topic.title: How to Add MathML Equations in WebHelp Output

body.p: Currently, only Firefox can render MathML equations embedded in the HTML code. MathJax is a solution to properly view MathML equations embedded in HTML content in a variety of browsers.

If you have DocBook or DITA content that has embedded MathML equations and you want to properly view the equations in published HTML output types (such as WebHelp), you need to add a reference to the MathJax script in the head element of all HTML files that have the equation embedded.

For DITA documents, you can also use the following procedure:
Edit a DITA Map WebHelp transformation scenario and open the Parameters tab.
Set the following parameter to point to an XML resource file that contains your script, depending on your type of WebHelp system.
WebHelp Responsive Systems - Set the webhelp.fragment.head parameter to point to your resource file.
WebHelp Classic Systems - Set the webhelp.head.script parameter to point to your resource file.
Run the transformation scenario.
Result: The equation should now be properly rendered in the WebHelp output for other browsers.

section.title: How to Add Support for MathML when Generating WebHelp from a Command Line

ol.li: Download and unzip the DITA 1.3 Support for Open Toolkit 1.x distribution package. It includes 4 DITA-OT plugins.
Copy the four plugin directories to your /plugins directory.
In the home directory of your DITA-OT installation, run the ant -f integrator.xml command.
